Key Match Events: Buddy Hield led a mostly reserve unit that quickly turned the game in Golden State's favor with 28-11, quarter-ending run that opened an eight-point advantage.
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors had only four points to show for the first 4:45 of the game and trailed by nine before Hield led the comeback.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Golden State finished 20-for-50 from outside the arc.
Utah countered with just 9-for-42 success (21.4 percent) from beyond the arc.
Others: Brandin Podziemski scored 15 points, Moses Moody had 12 and Kevon Looney chipped in with nine points and 10 rebounds off the Golden State bench.
The Warriors had 35 assists on 51 hoops.
